Fillings

Fillings

NHS

£70.70

Private

From £79.99

What are Fillings?

Fillings are used to fill cavities - holes in your tooth - caused by decay

NHS Fillings use a silver coloured material known as Amalgam, which is made up of mixture of metals such as silver, tin and copper

Private Fillings use a tooth coloured material known as Composite which is made up of a mixture of resin and glass.

Key Benefits

Fillings prevent toothache, bad breath, infection, and even the loss of teeth which can result from a cavity or damaged tooth.

Some signs you may need a filling include:

  • Toothache
  • Sudden pain when chewing
  • Sensitivity to hot or cold food and drink

What to expect?

You can expect the following during a filling:

  • Your dentist will numb the area around the tooth with a local anaesthetic
  • Your dentist will remove any decayed or damaged parts of the tooth
  • Your dentist will prepare the tooth for the filling by cleaning and drying the area
  • Your dentist will fill the cavity or damage with filling material
  • Your dentist will ensure that your bite and overall feel of the mouth is right
